qas.question: What started about 4000 years after copper smelting was discovered?

answers.text: Alloying copper with tin to make bronze

qas.question: What are the first datings of Bronze artifacts from the Vinca culture?
When did the Bronze Age began in Southeastern Europe?
What was the transition between the Neolithic period and the bronze age called?
What is an alloy of copper and zinc?

plausible_answers.text: Alloying copper with tin to make bronze

qas.question: What started about 3000 years after copper smelting was discovered?
What are the first datings of Platinum artifacts from the Vinca culture?
When did the Silver Age begin in Southeastern Europe?
What was the transition between the Neolithic period and the silver age called?
What is an alloy of copper and brass?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Alloying copper with tin to make bronze<b5_0/><a0_0/> was first practiced about 4000 years after the discovery of copper smelting, and about 2000 years after "natural bronze" had come into general use[citation needed]. Bronze artifacts from the Vinča culture date to <a1_0><b6_0>4500 BC<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Sumerian and Egyptian artifacts of copper and bronze alloys date to 3000 BC. The Bronze Age began in Southeastern Europe around <a2_0><b7_0>3700–3300 BC<b7_0/><a2_0/>, in Northwestern Europe about 2500 BC. It ended with the beginning of the Iron Age, 2000–1000 BC in the Near East, 600 BC in Northern Europe. The transition between the Neolithic period and the Bronze Age was formerly termed the <a3_0>Chalcolithic<a3_0/> period (copper-stone), with copper tools being used with stone tools. This term has gradually fallen out of favor because in some parts of the world the <b8_0>Chalcolithic<b8_0/> and Neolithic are coterminous at both ends. <a4_0>Brass<a4_0/>, an alloy of copper and <b9_0>zinc<b9_0/>, is of much more recent origin. It was known to the Greeks, but became a significant supplement to bronze during the Roman Empire.
